DOC.brief_title: D-dimer Oral Anticoagulation Therapy Patients With Mechanical Valve Replacement
DOC.detailed_description: Background : The optimal intensity oral anticoagulation China patient undergo mechanical valve replacement still controversial due different risk profile thrombophilia bleed Chinese patient . Elevated D-dimer could reflect pro-thrombogenic prothrombotic state , thus might use decide intensity oral anticoagulation . Objective : This study evaluate whether elevated D-dimer level could help determine intensity oral anticoagulation patient mechanical heart valve prosthesis . Methods : A single-center , prospective study perform . 629 Patients mechanical valve replacement receive oral anticoagulation . The patient randomly assign three group The intensity anticoagulation group one standard intensity ( INR:2.5-3.5 ) . The intensity anticoagulation group two keep low intensity without adjustment ( INR:1.6-2.6 ) , group three , The intensity anticoagulation maintain low level initiatively ( INR:1.6-2.6 ) , D-dimer test analyze two time 3 month later . In case D-dimer level elevate , adjust intensity anticoagulation standard level . The endpoint study subsequent thromboembolic major bleed average follow-up 2 year .
